statements: SELECT * FROM temperature_data
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE date = '2021-10-15'
SELECT date, location FROM temperature_data WHERE temperature > 25
SELECT * FROM temperature_data ORDER BY temperature DESC
SELECT AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM temperature_data
SELECT * FROM temperature_data WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT location, AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM temperature_data GROUP BY location HAVING AVG(temperature) > 20
SELECT date, location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE location = 'New York' AND temperature < 10 ORDER BY temperature ASC
SELECT date, location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-04-30' AND location LIKE 'Lo%' ORDER BY date
SELECT MAX(temperature) AS max_temp, MIN(temperature) AS min_temp FROM temperature_data WHERE date = '2021-10-15'
SELECT * FROM temperature_data
SELECT location_id, temperature, date FROM temperature_data
SELECT city, country FROM location
SELECT * FROM location
SELECT city, country, location_id FROM location
SELECT * FROM temperature_data ORDER BY date DESC, temperature ASC
SELECT location_id, city FROM location WHERE country = 'USA'
SELECT AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM temperature_data WHERE date = '2021-10-15'
SELECT city, country FROM location WHERE city LIKE 'New%'
SELECT location.*, temperature FROM location INNER JOIN temperature_data ON location.location_id = temperature_data.location_id
SELECT * FROM temperatures WHERE id = 1;
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperatures ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT name, country FROM locations WHERE id = 2;
SELECT date, temperature FROM temperatures WHERE date >= '2023-01-01';
SELECT id, country, name FROM locations ORDER BY name ASC, country DESC;
SELECT * FROM temperatures WHERE temperature > 30 ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT location, AVG(temperature) as avg_temp FROM temperatures GROUP BY location HAVING AVG(temperature) > 25
SELECT location, date, temperature FROM temperatures WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30' ORDER BY temperature DESC
SELECT locations.name, temperatures.temperature FROM temperatures JOIN locations ON temperatures.location = locations.id
SELECT location, COUNT(id) as total_temperatures FROM temperatures GROUP BY location HAVING COUNT(id) > 10
SELECT * FROM temperature_data
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE temperature > 20
SELECT location, date FROM date_location_mapping ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT location, min_temperature, max_temperature FROM temperature_limits WHERE location = 'New York'
SELECT location_name, latitude, longitude FROM location_info
SELECT * FROM temperature_data WHERE location = 'New York' ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE temperature > 30
SELECT location, max_temperature FROM temperature_limits WHERE location = 'Los Angeles'
SELECT temperature, location FROM temperature_data WHERE date = '2022-10-15' AND temperature BETWEEN 25 AND 30 ORDER BY location ASC
SELECT location_name, date FROM date_location_mapping INNER JOIN location_info ON date_location_mapping.location_id = location_info.location_id WHERE latitude > 40
SELECT * FROM temperatures WHERE temperature > 25 ORDER BY date ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperatures WHERE location='New York' AND date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp FROM temperatures WHERE location='Paris';
SELECT * FROM locations ORDER BY location_name DESC;
SELECT user_id, user_name, email FROM users WHERE user_name LIKE 'J%' AND email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT * FROM temperatures ORDER BY date DESC, location ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT location, temperature FROM temperature_data WHERE temperature > 25 AND location_id = 3 ORDER BY temperature DESC;
SELECT date_name AS 'Date', AVG(temperature) AS 'Average Temperature' FROM temperature_data JOIN dates ON temperature_data.date_id = dates.date_id GROUP BY date_name HAVING AVG(temperature) > 20;
SELECT location_name, COUNT(*) AS 'Data Count' FROM temperature_data JOIN locations ON temperature_data.location_id = locations.location_id GROUP BY location_name ORDER BY 'Data Count' DESC;
SELECT user_name, email FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com';
